intro: Impatiens lupangaensis, commonly known as the Lupanga Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
